Does the patient display any of the following risk factors for MDR (multi-drug resistant) S. pneumoniae?

• Chronic heart disease
• Renal disease
• Diabetes mellitus
• Alcoholism
• Neoplastic disease
• Asplenia
• Immunosuppression
• Prior antimicrobial therapy within 90 days
Is there a suspicion of tuberculosis?
Does the patient have a contraindication to Azithromycin?

Azithromycin 500 mg once, then 250 mg PO daily for 4 days
Does the patient have a Penicillin allergy (PCN anaphylaxis)?
Consult the relevant infectious disease or antibiotic stewardship personnel
Moxifloxacin 400 mg daily for 7 days

Is there a possibility of  CAUTI (catheter associated UTI)? Is the patient currently catheterized, or has been within the previous 48 hours?
Discontinue catheter if able, or change catheter if not. If symptoms persist then start this guideline again from the beginning.
